Article.ArticleTitle: Correspondence: Inaccurate reference leads to tripling of reported FND prevalence.

Abstract.AbstractText: • Perez et al asserted that FND is the "2nd most common" diagnosis in outpatient neurology. • Stone et al (2010), cited by Perez et al, does not support the “2nd most common” claim. • In Stone et al, a broad “functional/psychological” category was the second most common. • FND is not synonymous with the “functional/psychological” category in Stone et al.

MedlineCitation.CoiStatement: Declaration of Competing Interest David Tuller's academic position at University of California, Berkeley, is largely funded through crowdfunded donations to the university from patients with ME/CFS, Long Covid, and other complex chronic conditions.
